devdoc.author: Stanisław Głogowski <stan@pillarproject.io>
devdoc.details: The process of adding root node consists of 3 steps: 1. `submitNode` - should be called from ENS node owner, 2. Change ENS node owner in ENS registry to ENS controller, 3. `verifyNode` - should be called from previous ENS node owner, To register sub node, `msg.sender` need to send valid signature from one of guardian key. Once registration is complete `msg.sender` becoming both node owner and `addr` record value. After registration sub node cannot be replaced.

AddrChanged(bytes32,address).details: Emitted when the address field in node resolver is changed

NodeReleased(bytes32,address).details: Emitted when new node is released

NodeSubmitted(bytes32,address).details: Emitted when new node is submitted

NodeVerified(bytes32).details: Emitted when the existing owner is verified

RegistryChanged(address).details: Emitted when ENS registry address is changed

params.typedDataDomainNameHash: hash of a typed data domain name
params.typedDataDomainVersionHash: hash of a typed data domain version

releaseNode(bytes32).details: Should be called from the previous ENS node owner

submitNode(bytes32).details: Should be called from the current ENS node owner

verifyNode(bytes32).details: Should be called from the previous ENS node owner

devdoc.title: ENS controller
